strapiPost.title: Northwest Arkansas's Newest Professional Sport Is Padel
strapiPost.content:
North America's first Pro Padel League is coming to Arkansas, establishing a franchise at Matrix Racquet Club, an 11-acre complex in Lowell with indoor and outdoor courts for tennis, pickleball, and Arkansas's first padel courts.

  • What's padel? A cousin sport of pickleball, padel is a fast-paced racquet game played in doubles on a smaller tennis court where the ball can be bounced off glass walls surrounding the court.
  • In season: The PPL's inaugural season will begin in the spring and end with the PPL Cup Championship in June. The inaugural PPL player draft will take place on Mar 20.

Learn more about The Pro Padel League HERE.
